title: More than 10 million Brexit 50p coins to be minted - three times more than previously thought
text:
The Treasury is to mint 10 million Brexit 50p coins - three times more than previously planned, The Telegraph can reveal.

The plans are due to be signed off later on Tuesday at a meeting of the Queen with her Privy Council - a formal requirement so they can become legal tender.

Treasury sources said three million coins - imprinted with the Brexit date of 31 October - will be ready to spend by the end of the month.

A further 7 million will be struck in the first year on the orders of Chancellor Sajid Javid.

One source said that the coins had to be approved at the Privy Council so the coins had "legal tender status for when it is introduced on the day we leave".
